text.0: with this my reverent hymn i call agni for you the son of strength.
text.1: dear wisest envoy served with noble sacrifice immortal messenger of all.
text.2: his two red horses allsupporting let him yoke let him wellworshipped urge them fast.
text.3: then hath the sacrifice good prayers and happy end and heavenly gift of wealth to men.
text.4: the flame of him the bountiful the muchinvoked hath mounted up.
text.5: and his redcoloured smokeclouds reach and touch the sky the men are kindling agni well.
text.6: thee thee most glorious one we make our messenger bring the gods hither to the feast.
text.7: give us o son of strength all food that fcedeth man give that for which we pray to thee.
text.8: thou agni art the homesteads lord our herald at the sacrifice.
text.9: lord of all boons thou art the cleanser and a sage pay worship and enjoy the good.
text.10: give riches to the sacrificer o most wise for thou art he who granteth wealth.
text.11: inspire with zeal each priest at this our solemn rite all who are skilled in singing praise.
text.12: o agni who art worshipped well dear let our princes he to thee.
text.13: our wealthy patrons who are governors of men who part as gifts their stalls of kine.
text.14: they in whose home her hand bearing the sacred oil iḷā sits down wellsatisfied.
text.15: guard them victorious god from slander and from harm give us a refuge famed afar.
text.16: do thou a priest with pleasant tongue most wise and very near to us.
text.17: agni bring riches hither to our liberal chiefs and speed the oflering of our gifts.
text.18: they who bestow as bounty plenteous wealth of steeds moved by desire of great renown.
text.19: do thou with saving help preserve them from distress most youthful with a hundred forts.
text.20: the god who gives your wealth demands a full libation poured to him.
text.21: pour ye it forth then fill the vessel full again then doth the god pay heed to you.
text.22: him have the gods appointed priest of sacrifice oblationbearer passing wise.
text.23: agni gives wealth and valour to the worshipper to folk who offer up their gifts.
